software.name: moodle
software.description: Moodle is a learning platform designed to provide educators, administrators and learners with a single robust, secure and integrated system to create personalised learning environments.

template_files.title: configuration file
template_files.content:
<?php  // Moodle configuration file

unset($CFG);
global $CFG;
$CFG = new stdClass();

$CFG->dbtype    = 'mysqli';
$CFG->dblibrary = 'native';
$CFG->dbhost    = '_Engines_Environment(dbhost)';
$CFG->dbname    = '_Engines_Environment(dbname)';
$CFG->dbuser    = '_Engines_Environment(dbuser)';
$CFG->dbpass    = '_Engines_Environment(dbpasswd)';
$CFG->prefix    = '';
$CFG->dboptions = array (
  'dbpersist' => 0,
  'dbport' => '',
  'dbsocket' => '',
);

$CFG->wwwroot   = 'http://_Engines_Builder(fqdn)';
 
$CFG->dataroot  = '_Engines_Environment(VOLDIR)';
$CFG->admin     = 'admin';

$CFG->directorypermissions = 0777;

require_once(dirname(__FILE__) . '/lib/setup.php');

// There is no php closing tag in this file,
// it is intentional because it prevents trailing whitespace problems!

software.installation_report_template:
goto _Engines_Builder(http_protocol)://_Engines_Builder(fqdn)/ and follow the wizard to complete the install
Note: After you click continue the the Moodle install process takes several a few minutes to complete. Only click once!
